TopicTitle: Possible to have both Mac & Windows in same folder?

Articles.Content:
I was wondering if it would be possible to put both in the same folder (as if on a network drive). I'd like to be able to share things between my systems, and this would make it easier.

If so, what is needed?

Thanks
Using Parallels or some other vmware might work for you.

I know how to "share" a folder, was wondering if there was some way to put all the executables in the same folder so that both the win and mac systems could run it from the same folder.

Unfortunately, I've been trying to run KSP on my Macbook Pro, and the FPS is very low, so I'm not going to bother.

It won't work well. Macs tend to add 'ghost' files as metadata to a lot of files and folders. These additional files can trip up the KSP loader when running KSP from a non-Mac machine. You can avoid this by ensuring that all files and folders under GameData are listed as read-only.
